caption:
April 24, 2013, marked the Rana Plaza factory collapse in Bangladesh, a tragedy that left over a thousand garment workers dead, highlighting the unsafe work conditions and obscurity of most supply chains in the industry.Â Â 

At Kotn, we believe that traceabilityâ€”the knowledge of where a product came from, who made it, and whenâ€”shouldnâ€™t be a luxury, but a standard. Itâ€™s why we work with our partners directly, ensuring living wages and safe working conditions at every step of our supply chain. 

So today, in honour of Fashion Revolution Day, we want you to meet some of our makers. Explore our stories to meet the people behind the fibre, fabric, and seams of Kotn!

caption:
An ancient practice, the art of natural dyeing makes the most of the resources already at our, and in our, disposal. Artist and Natural Dyer @caramariepiazza recycles food and floral waste to create her dye matter and transform pre-existing pieces, limiting household and closet waste. 

We asked Cara to walk us through one of her favourites techniquesâ€”ice dyeingâ€”as a part of our Sustainability Series. Explore our stories to see how she does it!

caption:

caption:
After 20th century painter Paul Kleeâ€™s voyage to Tunisia in 1914, which inspired some of his greatest colour work, he shifted his focus to Egypt. Studying the movement of the sun, he noticed how its light transformed the landscapeâ€™s mud-based buildings.Â 

The colours of those transformations inspired his artwork, which in turn, inspired the colour palette of our Linen Bedding collection. Rich, saturated shades inspired by the brilliance of the Egyptian sun blending with the landscape.

caption:
We have a plastic problem and itâ€™s invaded our wardrobes. The prevalence of synthetic fabrics in clothingâ€”like polyester, spandex and acrylicâ€”is causing millions of microplastic fibres to leech into our waterways with every laundry cycle. 

Thatâ€™s why we focus on natureâ€™s finest: super-soft, plastic-free, naturally breathable fibres that can biodegrade at the end of their lifecycle. 

Explore our stories to learn more and take action with your own synthetic pieces.
